greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} 1 / (1 + k*x^k)^k.
comment: For n > 36 is a(n) > 0 if n is even and a(n) < 0 if n is odd.
This sequence is obtained from the generalized Euler transform in A266964 by taking f(n) = n, g(n) = -n. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 18 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..6224 (terms 0..1000 from Vaclav Kotesovec)
formula: a(0) = 1 and a(n) = (1/n) * Sum_{k=1..n} b(k)*a(n-k) where b(n) = Sum_{d|n} d^2*(-d)^(n/d). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 18 2017
program: (PARI) N=66; x='x+O('x^N); Vec(1/prod(k=1, N, (1+k*x^k)^k)) \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 18 2017
(1..n).each{|i| s += i * f_ary[i] * g_ary[i] ** (n / i) if n % i == 0}
(1..n).each{|i| ary << (1..i).inject(0){|s, j| s + a[j] * ary[-j]} / i}
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 07 2016
